SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.bookshelf

Class Bookshelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.bookshelf.Bookshelf
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CardBookshelf, PlayerBookshelf
public abstract class Bookshelf extends Object implements Serializable
the bookshelf class stores the tiles taken by the players in the game, it can also been use for a bookshelf pattern reference in cards
See Also:

    • getAllItemTiles

      public Map<ItemTile,Integer> getAllItemTiles()
      the method return all the tiles in the bookshelf
      Returns:
      a Map which represent the Item tile and the number of occurrence of that item

    • getItemTile

      public Optional<ItemTile> getItemTile(Coordinates c) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      it returns, if is present, the itemTile in a specific coordinate
      Parameters:
      c - the coordinate to check
      Returns:
      an optional of the item tile, which contains the tile, if is present
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index required is outside the matrix domain

    • nElementsOverlapped

      public int nElementsOverlapped(Bookshelf bookshelf)
      Method to calculate the number of ItemTiles that are in the same position and equal between this bookshelf and the one passed as parameter
      Parameters:
      bookshelf - the bookshelf to check the elements on
      Returns:
      an int that is the number of ItemTile in the same position and equal between the two bookshelf

    • getItemTileMap

      public Map<Coordinates,ItemTile> getItemTileMap()
      This method is used to retrieve a complete mapping of the ItemTiles inside the bookshelf
      Returns:
      the map of the coordinates that has a ItemTile in it
